Generation I.Red: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.
Generation I.Yellow: A Pok é mon that can memorize anything. It never forgets what it learns--that's why this Pok é mon is smart.
Generation I.Stadium: A Pokémon that uses psychic power. It is highly intelligent and capable of instantly identifying its foe's weakness.

Generation II.Gold: Closing both its eyes heightens all its other senses. This enables it to use its abilities to their extremes.
Generation II.Silver: Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything.
Generation II.Crystal: It has an IQ of 5000. It calculates many things in order to gain the edge in every battle.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Closing both its eyes heightens all its other senses. This enables it to use its abilities to their extremes. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Alakazam 's brain continually grows, making its head far too heavy to support with its neck. This Pok é mon holds its head up using its psychokinetic power instead.
Generation III.Sapphire: Alakazam 's brain continually grows, infinitely multiplying brain cells. This amazing brain gives this Pok é mon an astoundingly high IQ of 5,000. It has a thorough memory of everything that has occurred in the world.
Generation III.Emerald: While it has strong psychic abilities and high intelligence, an Alakazam 's muscles are very weak. It uses psychic power to move its body.
Generation III.FireRed: It does not like physical attacks very much. Instead, it freely uses extra-sensory powers to defeat foes.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its IQ (intelligence quotient) is said to be around 5,000.

Generation IV.Diamond: Its superb memory lets it recall everything it has experienced from birth. Its IQ exceeds 5,000.
Generation IV.Pearl: Its highly developed brain is on par with a supercomputer. It can use all forms of psychic abilities.
Generation IV.Platinum: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Closing both its eyes heightens all its other senses. This enables it to use its abilities to their extremes.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything.

Generation V.Black: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.
Generation V.White: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.
Generation V.Black 2: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.
Generation V.White 2: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.

Generation VI.X: Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything.
Generation VI.Y: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its IQ (intelligence quotient) is said to be around 5,000.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Alakazam's brain continually grows, making its head far too heavy to support with its neck. This Pokémon holds its head up using its psychokinetic power instead.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Alakazam's brain continually grows, infinitely multiplying brain cells. This amazing brain gives this Pokémon an astoundingly high IQ of 5,000. It has a thorough memory of everything that has occurred in the world.

Generation VII.Sun: As a result of Mega Evolution, its power has been entirely converted into psychic energy, and it has lost all strength in its muscles.
Generation VII.Moon: Its hidden psychic power has been unleashed. A glance at someone gives it knowledge of the course of that person's life, from birth to death.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It sends out psychic power from the red organ on its forehead to foresee its opponents' every move.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Having traded away its muscles, Alakazam's true power has been unleashed. With its psychic powers, it can foresee all things.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: It's adept at precognition. When attacks completely miss Alakazam, that's because it's seeing the future.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: It's adept at precognition. When attacks completely miss Alakazam, that's because it's seeing the future.

Generation VIII.Sword: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.
Generation VIII.Shield: Alakazam wields potent psychic powers. It's said that this Pokémon used these powers to create the spoons it holds.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its superb memory lets it recall everything it has experienced from birth. Its IQ exceeds 5,000.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its highly developed brain is on par with a supercomputer. It can use all forms of psychic abilities.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: The longer Alakazam lives, the larger and heavier its head becomes. Our tests have shown that the strength of its psychic powers correlates positively to the weight of its head.

Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Loop Lagoon , Insular Sea ( Wanderer ) Soothing Wetlands , Challenge Beach ( Max Raid Battle )
